objects.name: Analytic 1351
objects.description: A process explicitly forges its parent using EXTENDED_STARTUPINFO + PROC_THREAD_ATTRIBUTE_PARENT_PROCESS (UpdateProcThreadAttribute → CreateProcess[A/W]/CreateProcessAsUserW) or other Native API paths, resulting in **mismatched/implausible lineage** across ETW EventHeader ProcessId, Security 4688 Creator Process ID/Name, and sysmon ParentProcessGuid. Often paired with privilege escalation when the chosen parent runs as SYSTEM.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: etw:Microsoft-Windows-Kernel-Process
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: api_call: UpdateProcThreadAttribute (PROC_THREAD_ATTRIBUTE_PARENT_PROCESS) and CreateProcess* with EXTENDED_STARTUPINFO_PRESENT / StartupInfoEx

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: etw:Microsoft-Windows-Kernel-Process
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: process_start: EventHeader.ProcessId true parent vs reported PPID mismatch

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Correlation window between UpdateProcThreadAttribute/CreateProcess* and the resulting process (default 5–10 minutes).
Legitimate binaries that commonly use StartupInfoEx/PPID assignment (e.g., consent.exe, svchost.exe during UAC).
Minimum privilege/integrity gap between chosen parent and real caller to raise severity.
Number of mismatched sources (0–3) before alerting to reduce noise.
List of SYSTEM parents that, if spoofed, auto‑escalate severity (e.g., lsass.exe, services.exe, wininit.exe).
